task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 217°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will start by looking up to find the roofline.
My heading has unexpectedly changed to 0° North, but the target building is at 217° South-West, so I need to rotate back to face it.
I am currently looking down at -30 degrees, so I need to rotate my view upwards to see the top of the building.
My heading has reset to 0° North again, so I must rotate back to 218° South-West and adjust my pitch to view the building.
I am looking down at the base of the building; to see the full height, I need to tilt my view up significantly.
My heading has reset to 0° North again; I must rotate back to 218° South-West and set my pitch to 30° up to see the top of the building.
I can see the top of the building, so now I will look down to see the base to get a complete view of its height.
My heading has reset to 0° North again; I need to rotate back to 218° South-West and set my pitch to look at the base of the building.

I have now viewed the building from its base to its roof by looking up and down; it appears to be approximately 8 stories high, and assuming a standard height of 3 meters per story, I estimate the total height to be 24 meters.
